page.title: 20Kirkby Today:A Brief Review.
page.content: Kirkby has altered greatly since Norman times but particularly so during the 1950's and 60's when a large industrial site was built. An increase in industry and workforce necessitated new settlement areas, additional amenities and more efficient transportation networks. Consequently Kirkby can now boast two motorways, the M57 and M62, a conference centre at the magnificent Kirkby Suite, new schools and one of the north's most modern town centres. In addition, it has a swimming pool built to Olympic standard and a first class Sports Centre which is one of the largest and best equipped complexes in the U.K. The Athletics Stadium, sited alongside, is of international standard and has a banked cycle track which is used by the world famous Kirkby Cycling Club.
